page.title: 03FARMING IN DOLPHINTON
page.content: There are 10 farms in Dolphinton:- Townhead, The Bank (run together as one unit), Townfoot, Kirkhouse, Roberton Mains, Croft-an-Righ, Westmill, Newmill, Kippit and Haughhead. There is one dairy farm, 9 have sucker cows and 5 have sheep flocks. All have grass for grazing, 6 make silage by storing chopped grass in pits, and 6 make hay either in small square bales or large 5ft. diameter round bales. 2 farms grow oats, 8 grow spring barley, 1 grows winter barley and 1 grows rye and triticale. No wheat is grown. 6 farms have areas of rough grazing, 2 have heather hills. Produce sold per year includes:- 200,000 litres milk, 221 fat cattle, 388 store cattle, 2 breeding heifers, 1126 fat lambs, 210 store lambs, 160 breeding sheep, 100 tonnes grain, 55 tonnes straw.
